content.description: This is the furthest right route, that begins up a mellow slab where the trail hits the wall. After the slab there is a small vertical sections ascending a right angling broken crack system to a ledge. After this the crux awaits to cold shut anchors at 10.b

One of the best routes in the area (Weeping Cave).  This is the one with several hanging chain draws.

This route begins just to the left of the pine tree, and means business passing the first bolt. It traverses left after the third bolt, then ascends a left leaning crack/dihedral. It has 2 chain draws on it. you need 6 draws, in addition to the two chain draws, cold shuts for an anchor.
content.location: second route right of the outside of the cave, fixed chain draws

content.description: Starts on slabby featured orange rock...some choss but quality gets better after roof. CLimb to the left of the roof and stand on nice ledge before entering the crux move.
content.protection: Bolts all the way up to shutters.
content.location: First route the climber trails leads up to. Route is located in the middle of the wall, orange rock about 50-75' to the right of cave.

content.description: This left to right traversing route is amazing.  Crux is right off the ground.  Make sure to stick clip the first bolt.  This thing hits you with a nasty v6 boulder problem, followed by some 5.11ish climbing to another v5 problem right below the chains.  Classic line!
content.protection: bolts, some fixed draws, and cold shuts
content.location: At the Weeping Cave, this is the left to right traversing line that starts near the back of the cave.

content.description: Its the two bolt extension of Easy Street. Clip the anchors and continue climbing past a bolt above a ledge...although the bolt is there, don't assume you exit left after Easy Street anchors. Be prepared for a bouldery crux sequence.
content.protection: two bolt extension and shares same anchors as Kaya.
content.location: Same start as Easy street, climb easy street and continue past anchors.

content.description: This is a great warmup. the first 30 feet is easy climbing up low angle, golden brown stone, with the steeper crux (5.9+) at the visible chains. The next 15 feet follows two more bolts with a 5.11- move passing the chains ending at cold shuts.
content.protection: all bolts, chains and cold shuts
content.location: At the Weeping Cave this is the next route to the right of 9cow Wife

content.description: Techy 5.11ish climbing leads to an extremely powerful roof with sharp holds on the headwall.   Probably 5.13a, but I didn't want to be too soft.
content.location: At the Weeping Cave, this is the first climb to the right of Qt. of Blood Technique (fixed chain draws)

content.description:
Great power moves right off the deck! 30 feet of sweetened condensed awesome.

Stand on the "cheat block" stone below the first bolt. There is an obvious positive jug to start on. Campus and power through this open book section till you get to the jugs above the second bolt.

Follow the line to a rail and undercling just above the 5th bolt. From here the crux moves up and around the left edge of the bolt line.

Good luck keeping it together for these last powerful moves to jugs and coldshuts!

I skip the 7th bolt.
content.protection: 7 bolts to coldshuts. Stick Clip. Knee Pad. Extend the 6th draw to make clipping easier. Skip the 7th bolt if you're serious about sending.
content.location: Furthest left in the weeping cave. End links up with Hoss Choss and Chaos.

content.protection: As with all the cave routes, be mindful of possible loose stone.

content.description: Fun climb. Use offwidth, stemming, and wide crack technique to make it up this SPORT route. Protection is great. Wear a helmet!!! You will scuff your head if not careful...and you definitely do not want to take a fall, many places you will hit back of your head...so just wear helmet.
content.location: To the left of Sasquatch. You can see shuts from the trail...left of the chmney dihedral. Both Backscratcher and Sasquatch are on right sided of the wall, by themselves.

content.description:
Easy to moderate climbing leads to a tricky roof.

Climb over a bulge and angle right up to an orange, right facing dihedral to a tricky roof.
content.location: In the Weeping Cave sector: two climbs to the right of Qt. of Blood Technique (climb with the fixed chain draws)
